item.title: 5 Minute Tutorials: Using Protocol Buffers in R
item.description: Quick Overview Hi hi! This is a quick tutorial on using Protocol Buffers (protobufs) in R, particularly for working with GTFS-realtime data. If youâ€™ve ever struggled to parse protobuf data, this guide will walk through the key steps to get you started. What are Protocol Buffers? Protocol Buffers (protobufs) are a language-neutral, platform-neutral extensible mechanism for serializing structured data. They are commonly used in real-time data applications, such as GTFS-realtime, because they are lightweight and efficient.
